title: Lexmark CX331adwe Firmware Downgrade Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Lexmark CX331adwe printers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the `/usr/bin/hydra` service, which listens on TCP port 9100 by default. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a firmware image before using it to perform an upgrade. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: Lexmark has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.lexmark.com/en_us/solutions/security/lexmark-security-advisories.html
timeline:
2023-12-01 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2024-05-31 - Coordinated public release of advisory
